adjectives.description: sayable (comparative more sayable, superlative most sayable)

entries.meaning: Capable of being pronounced or uttered; articulable. [from 17th c.]
examples: Rimbaud is the enfant terrible who burns through the sayable; Oppen is the poet of the left whose quiet is a sign of commitment.

entries.meaning: That which can be said. [from 20th c.]
examples: On the other hand, verbs indicate incomplete sayables – predicates – that are related to actions and undergoing of actions.
